result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis J Kearney III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Curtis J Kearney in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel requests Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates, due to reasons put forth on the record. No objections from the State. Court grants request and sets 11/23/2022 deadline for filing trial documents. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Curtis J Kearney in court with attorney Connor Romenesko, via zoom.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials. Defense further requests a Plea/Sentencing date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Curtis J Kearney in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  John Rejowski on behalf of Amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Curtis J Kearney in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  John Rejowski on behalf of Amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense has offer, but is waiting for more discovery from the state. For reasons stated on the record, defense requests status conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 16, via Zoom.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Curtis J Kearney in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis J Kearney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Nicolas Remeo, Officer Milwaukee Police Department.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Curtis J Kearney in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Curtis J Kearney in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis J Kearney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 4901 West Hoyt Place #106, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
